Title: State Price Density Process
Notes: State price density process under risk-neutral measure. Î¶_t represents the pricing kernel or stochastic discount factor.

Title: Put Option Price (Black-Scholes)
Notes: Black-Scholes formula for European put option. d_1 and d_2 calculated using standard Black-Scholes parameters.

Title: Risk-Neutral Density (Breeden-Litzenberger)
Notes: Extracts risk-neutral probability density from option prices. Second derivative of call price with respect to strike gives the implied density.

Title: Put Option Price (Garman-Kohlhagen)
Notes: Black-Scholes extension for FX options with domestic and foreign interest rates. Used for currency options pricing.

Title: Covered Interest Rate Parity
Notes: No-arbitrage relationship between spot and forward exchange rates. Fundamental relationship in international finance.

Title: Risk-Neutral Valuation
Notes: Fundamental theorem of asset pricing. Any derivative price equals discounted expected payoff under risk-neutral measure.

Title: Jump-Diffusion Option Pricing
Notes: Option pricing under Merton jump-diffusion model. Sum over Poisson-distributed jump counts with adjusted Black-Scholes formulas.

Title: Survival Probability
Notes: Probability of survival until time T under risk-neutral measure. Expressed as expectation of exponential integral of hazard rate process.

Title: Lognormal Jump Size Distribution

Notes: The lognormal jump size distribution is a fundamental component of Merton's (1976) jump-diffusion model for asset pricing. **Mathematical Foundation**: The jump size J_t follows a lognormal distribution
column6: Ïƒ_JÂ²). The expected jump size Ì„Î¼ = E[J_t] = e^{Î¼_J + Ïƒ_JÂ²/2} - 1 derives from the moment-generating property of lognormal distributions

The lognormal specification allows for fat-tailed return distributions that better match empirical observations than pure diffusion models. The drift adjustment (r - Î»Ì„Î¼) compensates for the expected jump impact to maintain risk-neutral pricing. **Key Assumptions**: Jump sizes are independent of the diffusion process and occur at Poisson arrival times. All jumps are multiplicative (percentage changes) rather than additive. The model assumes constant parameters and ignores stochastic volatility-jump interactions. **Limitations**: Underestimates extreme tail events (jumps are too small); cannot capture time-varying jump intensity or volatility smiles in implied volatility surfaces; assumes jumps are uncorrelated with diffusion volatility

Title: Discount Factor Relationships
Notes: Equivalence between discount factors bond prices and different compounding conventions. Fundamental relationship in fixed income mathematics.

Title: Fokker-Planck Equation
Notes: The Fokker-Planck equation represents the forward Kolmogorov equation for the evolution of probability density in diffusion processes
column5: particularly under local volatility dynamics. **Mathematical Foundation**: Derived from ItÃ´'s lemma applied to the stochastic differential equation dS = (r-q)S dt + Ïƒ_LV(S
column8: t) is the deterministic local volatility function. The equation âˆ‚p/âˆ‚t = -âˆ‚/âˆ‚S[Î¼(S
column10: t)p] describes how probability mass flows through state space
column11: with the drift term -(r-q)S representing the risk-neutral drift and the diffusion term Â½Ïƒ_LVÂ²(S
column12: t)SÂ² representing volatility-induced spreading. **Theoretical Basis**: As the forward Kolmogorov equation
column13: it governs the time evolution of the transition density p(S
column16: satisfying the Chapman-Kolmogorov equation and providing the foundation for Dupire's local volatility formula. **Key Assumptions**: Local volatility is a deterministic function of spot price S and time t; the process is Markovian with continuous paths; no jumps or discontinuities; complete markets under risk-neutral measure; twice continuously differentiable coefficients. **Limitations**: Assumes deterministic volatility (inconsistent with observed stochastic volatility in markets); numerical instability in Dupire's equation inversion; potential arbitrage opportunities if calibrated volatility violates no-arbitrage constraints; breaks down near maturity or extreme strikes; limited applicability to multi-asset or jump-diffusion models. **Practical Applications in Finance**: Central to local volatility modeling for reproducing observed implied volatility surfaces; enables calibration of option pricing models to market data; used in exotic option pricing where Black-Scholes assumptions fail; supports risk management through scenario analysis of probability distributions; facilitates model validation by comparing theoretical vs market-implied densities; enables volatility surface interpolation for unquoted strikes/maturity combinations. **Trading Strategies**: Local volatility models help identify mispriced options by comparing model prices with market quotes; support volatility arbitrage strategies; enable delta-hedging of complex derivatives; facilitate the pricing and hedging of volatility products like variance swaps. **Risk Management Applications**: Assessment of tail risk through probability density evolution; stress testing of derivative portfolios; calculation of Value-at-Risk measures; evaluation of model risk in option pricing; monitoring of volatility surface stability. **Related Concepts and Extensions**: Special case of Black-Scholes PDE when Ïƒ_LV is constant; generalized to stochastic volatility models (Heston Fokker-Planck equation with additional state variables); extended to LÃ©vy processes for jump-diffusion models; connects to Dupire's formula Ïƒ_LVÂ²(S
column17: t) = (âˆ‚C/âˆ‚T)/(Â½SÂ²âˆ‚Â²C/âˆ‚KÂ²) for calibration; related to backward Kolmogorov equation (Feynman-Kac) for pricing PDEs; foundation for multi-factor interest rate models; extends to path-dependent volatility models. **Implementation Considerations**: Requires numerical solution via finite difference methods (Crank-Nicolson scheme for stability); Monte Carlo simulation for calibration to market option prices; spectral methods for periodic boundaries; adaptive mesh refinement for accuracy near boundaries; implicit-explicit schemes for stiff equations; parallel computing for high-dimensional extensions. **Calibration Challenges**: Ill-posed inverse problem in Dupire's equation; requires dense option price data across strikes and maturities; sensitivity to market data noise and liquidity; regularization techniques needed to ensure positive definite volatility; iterative optimization methods for parameter fitting. **Computational Challenges**: High computational cost for real-time applications; numerical stability issues near maturity; boundary condition specification at S=0 and large S; memory requirements for multi-dimensional grids; convergence acceleration techniques needed for practical implementation.

Title: Key Rate Duration
Notes: Sensitivity of bond price to change in specific point on yield curve. Allows for hedging non-parallel yield curve shifts.

Title: Kolmogorov Forward Equation
Notes: Forward Kolmogorov equation describing evolution of transition probability density for diffusion processes.

Title: MBS Carry Return
Notes: Net carry return for mortgage-backed securities. Difference between weighted average coupon and funding costs.

Title: MBS Interest Cash Flow
Notes: Interest cash flow calculation for mortgage-backed securities. Based on beginning balance minus scheduled principal payments.

Title: MBS Scheduled Principal
Notes: Scheduled principal payment for mortgage-backed securities. Total mortgage payment minus interest portion.

Title: Moment Matching Parameters
Notes: Parameter calculation for lognormal moment matching approximation. Matches first two moments of distribution.

Title: Modified Duration
Notes: Modified duration measures price sensitivity to yield changes. Adjusts Macaulay duration for compounding frequency.

Title: Nelson-Siegel Yield Curve Model
Notes: Parametric yield curve model with level slope and curvature factors. Widely used for yield curve fitting and forecasting.

Title: PSA Prepayment Model
Notes: Public Securities Association prepayment benchmark for mortgage-backed securities. Standard industry convention for prepayment modeling.

Title: Rational Prepayment Model
Notes: Prepayment rate as ratio of yield incentive to refinance incentive. Captures economic rationality of mortgage prepayment decisions.

Title: TIPS Pricing
Equation: P^{TIPS}(t T) = P^{real}(t T) â‹… I_t

Notes: Internal rate of return calculation for bonds. Discount rate that equates present value of cash flows to market price.

Title: Garman-Kohlhagen Model
Notes: Black-Scholes extension for currency options. Incorporates both domestic and foreign interest rates for FX option pricing.

Title: Jarrow-Yildirim Inflation Model
Notes: Treats inflation index like foreign currency with nominal rate as domestic and real rate as foreign rate. Used for inflation derivatives pricing.

Title: Power Reverse Dual Currency
Notes: Structured FX product with power option features. Common in Japanese retail market with complex payoff structures.

Notes: Decomposition of traditional market beta in multi-factor context. Shows how factor loadings contribute to overall market beta.

Notes: Fair strike for variance swap equals time-averaged expected variance under risk-neutral measure. Fundamental pricing relationship for volatility derivatives.

Notes: Backward induction for Bermudan swaption pricing. Optimal exercise decision at each exercise date maximizes immediate exercise value versus continuation value.

Notes: Bayesian approach combining equilibrium returns with investor views. Produces stable expected return estimates for portfolio optimization.

Title: CAPM Expected Return
Notes: Capital Asset Pricing Model equilibrium relationship. Expected return equals risk-free rate plus beta times market risk premium.

Title: Cap Valuation
Notes: Interest rate cap value equals sum of individual caplet values. Portfolio of options on successive forward rates.

Title: Capital Asset Pricing Model
Notes: Fundamental equilibrium model relating expected return to systematic risk. Beta measures sensitivity to market movements.

Notes: Individual caplet pricing using Black-76 model. P(0 T_{i-1}) is discount factor and F is forward rate.

Title: Constant Maturity Swap
Notes: Swap with floating leg based on constant maturity swap rate. Exposes investor to long-term interest rate movements.

Title: Convexity Adjustment

Title: Digital Caplet/Floorlet
Notes: Binary option on interest rates paying fixed amount if rate exceeds strike. Used in structured interest rate products.

Notes: Bootstrapping discount factors from piecewise constant forward rates. Fundamental yield curve construction technique.

Title: Hazard Rate Process
Equation: Î»_t = Î»(t X_t) where X_t is state vector
Notes: General specification for hazard rate process in credit models. Allows for time-varying and state-dependent default intensity.

Title: Variance Swap Payoff
Notes: Variance swap payoff based on difference between realized and strike variance. Provides pure exposure to volatility.

Title: Realized Variance Calculation
Notes: Standard calculation for realized variance from daily returns. Annualized using 252 trading days convention.

Title: Year-on-Year Inflation Swap
Notes: Inflation swap exchanging fixed rate K for realized annual inflation rate. Path-dependent on inflation index movements.

Title: Zero-Coupon Inflation Swap
Notes: Zero-coupon inflation swap payoff at maturity. Single payment based on cumulative inflation over entire term.

Title: Neural Network Approximation
Notes: Deep learning approximation for option pricing. Neural network trained to approximate complex pricing functions.

Title: Binomial Tree Price (Complete)

Notes: Complete binomial tree pricing formula. Sum over all paths weighted by risk-neutral probabilities.

Title: Cholesky Decomposition
Notes: Matrix decomposition for generating correlated random variables. Essential for Monte Carlo simulation of multiple assets.

Title: Crank-Nicolson Scheme
Notes: Second-order accurate implicit finite difference scheme. Unconditionally stable for parabolic PDEs in option pricing.

Title: Density from Characteristic Function
Notes: Fourier inversion for probability density function. Enables option pricing when characteristic function is known but density is not.

Title: Importance Sampling
Notes: Variance reduction technique for Monte Carlo simulation. Uses different sampling distribution to improve efficiency.

Equation: V(t_i S_{t_i}) = max(exercise value ğ”¼^â„š[e^{-r(t_{i+1}-t_i)} V(t_{i+1} S_{t_{i+1}})|S_{t_i}])

Title: Longstaff-Schwartz Algorithm
Notes: Backward induction algorithm for American options using least-squares regression to estimate continuation values.

Title: Multi-Level Monte Carlo
Notes: Variance reduction technique using multiple discretization levels. Achieves optimal complexity for SDE simulation.

Title: Sobol Sequence (Quasi-Monte Carlo)
Notes: Low-discrepancy sequence for quasi-Monte Carlo integration. Achieves nearly 1/N convergence rate compared to 1/âˆšN for random sampling.

Notes: Moment matching approximation for basket options. Treats basket as single lognormal asset with matched moments.

Notes: Black's model for options on futures contracts. Standard for interest rate and commodity derivatives.

Notes: Fundamental PDE governing European option prices under Black-Scholes assumptions. Must satisfy terminal payoff condition.

Notes: Conditional distribution for Cox-Ingersoll-Ross short rate model. Non-central chi-squared with parameters ensuring positivity.

Title: Charm (Delta Decay)
Notes: Third-order Greek measuring how delta changes over time. Important for delta hedging rebalancing frequency decisions.

Title: Delta Sensitivity
Notes: First-order price sensitivity to underlying asset price. Measures hedge ratio for options and ranges from 0 to 1 for calls.

Title: Exchange Options (Margrabe)

Title: Gap Options
Notes: Options with trigger level K_1 different from strike K_2. Pays off only if underlying exceeds trigger and strike conditions.

Notes: Compound option to buy another option. Requires bivariate normal distribution M for valuation due to two exercise decisions.

Title: Rainbow Options (Maximum of Two)
Notes: Option on maximum of two assets. Uses bivariate normal distribution to account for correlation between underlying assets.

Title: Rho Interest Rate Sensitivity
Notes: Sensitivity of option price to changes in risk-free interest rate. Calls have positive rho puts have negative rho.

Title: Spread Options (Kirk Approximation)
Notes: Approximation for options on spread between two assets. Useful for crack spreads location spreads and similar instruments.

Notes: Time decay measuring how option value changes as expiration approaches. Always negative for European options.

Title: Vanna Cross Sensitivity
Notes: Second-order Greek measuring sensitivity of delta to volatility changes. Important for volatility trading strategies.

Title: Vasicek Bond Price

Notes: Affine solution for Vasicek model bond prices. Closed-form expression with A and B functions of model parameters.

Title: Vasicek Short Rate Distribution
Notes: Conditional distribution of short rate in Vasicek model. Gaussian with mean-reverting drift and time-dependent variance.

Title: Volga Second-Order Volatility

Title: Black-Scholes for Equity as Call
Notes: Merton model treating equity as call option on firm value. Strike equals debt face value D with maturity matching debt maturity.

Title: Black-76 for Futures Options
Notes: Black's model for European options on futures contracts. Standard for interest rate and commodity derivatives.

Notes: Valuation of Forward Rate Agreement based on difference between actual and contracted forward rates.

Title: Nelson-Siegel Extended
Notes: Svensson extension of Nelson-Siegel model with additional curvature factor Î»â‚‚ for improved yield curve fitting flexibility. Related to basic Nelson-Siegel model with 3 parameters.

Notes: Time-dependent extension of Vasicek model allowing exact calibration to initial yield curve through Î¸(t) function.

Notes: General framework for arbitrage-free modeling of entire forward rate curve evolution.

Notes: Sensitivity of option price to risk-free rate changes. Positive for calls negative for puts due to present value effects.

Notes: Alternating Direction Implicit method for multi-dimensional PDEs. Efficient for options with multiple state variables.

Notes: Autoregressive Integrated Moving Average model for time series forecasting. Standard tool for statistical arbitrage.
